page.title: 09SOFT FRUIT FARMING IN SESSAY
page.content: Many changes have occurred in agriculture this century but none has affected Sessay as much as the advent of the {Pick Your Own}farm. Here visitors gather the fruit of their choice paying less than market price for the privilege. Each weekend from June to August pickers, often towns- people having a day out, arrive in their hundreds if the weather is good, to pick fruit. There are two such farms in Sessay making us famous far and wide. One farmer has put 8 acres down to strawberries and as well as encouraging PYO he has built up a good trade with local retailers, hotels etc whilst still farming the rest of his land traditionally. The other enterprise is a{market {gardener}whose main crops are rasp- berries, strawberries & blackcurrants as well as many vegetables.
